VII.i.4.A.6.a
.
Definition:  Foster Parent
A
foster parent
is a person who stands in place of a Veteran’s parent for a continuous period of at least one year.
The one-year period must
start before the Veteran’s 21
st
birthday, and
continue for one year before the Veteran entered active duty.
The one-year period may end
after
the Veteran’s 21
st
birthday, as long as the requirements set forth in the previous bullet are met.
Note
:  A public or private institution
cannot
be a foster parent for VA purposes even if the institution is caring for the Veteran
in loco parentis
.
References
:
For
more information on the term foster parent, see
38 CFR 3.59
, and
a definition of
in loco parentis
, see
M21-1, Part VII, Subpart i, 4.A.6.b
.
